summary: This is an FBI agent's affidavit in support of a second search warrant for Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street, filed on July 6, 2019. It details observations from an initial search that corroborated a victim's descriptions of the interior, including busts, a taxidermied dog, and a massage room with nude artwork, establishing probable cause for further seizure of evidence related to sex trafficking of minors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary target of the investigation, charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. The affidavit describes his alleged sexual abuse of multiple minor girls at his New York residence from approximately 2002 to 2005.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Signed the initial search warrant for the Subject Premises on July 6, 2019, and before whom the affidavit was sworn.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A victim of Epstein's sexual abuse between approximately 2002 and 2005. Provided detailed descriptions of the interior of the New York residence, including specific items like busts, a taxidermied dog, and the massage room, which were corroborated during the initial search.

connections.description: Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 on multiple occasions at his New York residence when she was under the age of 18, as described in the affidavit and referenced indictment.
Judge Barbara Moses signed the search warrant authorizing the search of Epstein's premises, placing her in a judicial role overseeing the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Initial Search of 9 East 71st Street
events.description: Law enforcement executed a search warrant at Epstein's New York residence, commencing at approximately 6 p.m. Observations included busts, a massage room with nude artwork, a taxidermied dog, and a binder labeled 'PB Girls'.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse at New York Residence
events.description: The timeframe during which Jeffrey Epstein allegedly sexually abused multiple minor girls, including Victim-1, at his New York residence.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York (Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence, referred to as the 'Subject Premises')
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment and search warrant)
keyFacts: The search warrant affidavit was filed on July 6, 2019, seeking a second warrant for Epstein's New York home after an initial search that day found items corroborating a victim's account.

Victim-1's detailed descriptions of the residence's interior from 2005—including busts, a taxidermied dog, and a massage room with nude artwork—were observed during the initial search, supporting her reliability.
A binder labeled 'PB Girls' was observed, which investigators believe may refer to minor victims in Palm Beach, Florida, linking the New York and Florida aspects of the alleged conspiracy.
The affidavit references a grand jury indictment from July 2, 2019, charging Epstein with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, based on allegations of abuse from at least 2002-2005.
The affidavit notes Victim-1's personal history, including past marriage fraud and substance abuse, but states her information has been corroborated by independent evidence and other victims.
